body: This is expected behavior `shouldUnreigster: true` means we will remove input while they getting unmount, it's not a filter.
In version 7.12.x, this behavior was different. There, values that were not in the register were not passed.

@bluebill1049 is it possible to re open this? 

The docs say "only registered input will be included as submission data." which this doesn't hold true for, and doesn't mention any differences between reset and setting the initial default values.

I modified @adostal 's CSB to highlight the different behavior between reset and default values: https://codesandbox.io/s/cocky-smoke-phlpz?file=/src/App.js

Also, here's a CSB running 7.12.0 that shows my expected behavior working as described:
https://codesandbox.io/s/spring-pine-hhlf0?file=/src/App.js

My use case is that I have forms where I get the initial data asynchronously , and have been using reset to set the initial state. Is there a way to get this to not merge unregistered inputs when using reset?
thanks, @JGibel for the detailed reply and codesandbox, will take a look at the weekend. As far as I know, this is expected behavior, I will see if there is any workaround for your use case.

issue.title: fix #6482 reset formValues with shouldUnregister: true

repository.name: react-hook-form
repository.description: ðŸ“‹ React Hooks for form state management and validation (Web + React Native)

body:
> @JGibel I have same use case.
> My solution is with yup validation.
> 
> If you use yup validation:
> 
> ```js
> useEffect(() => {
>   form.reset(yupSchema.cast(data, {stripUnknown: true}));
> }, []);
> ```
> 
> stripUnknown - remove all properties where is not set in yup schema validator

This issue is getting resolved, will be released in the next patch.

issue.title: [Bug]: watch() misses last value after reset()

repository.name: react-hook-form
repository.description: ðŸ“‹ React Hooks for form state management and validation (Web + React Native)

issue.body:
### Version Number

7.15.3

### Codesandbox/Expo snack

https://codesandbox.io/s/hardcore-kepler-ihou8?file=/src/App.tsx

### Steps to reproduce

1. Visit codesandbox
2. See that "val: true" is never printed to console

### Expected behaviour

After the `useEffect()`, the value returned from `watch()` should be `true`.

It only happens when `shouldUnregister: true`

### What browsers are you seeing the problem on?

Chrome

### Relevant log output

_No response_

issue.title: [Bug]: Regression introduced in 7.15.3

repository.name: react-hook-form
repository.description: ðŸ“‹ React Hooks for form state management and validation (Web + React Native)

issue.body:
### Version Number

7.15.3

### Codesandbox/Expo snack

I'm currently unable to reproduce issue in Codesandbox, but I'm going to spend more time trying to reproduce it in the morning. I explain the issue in further detail below.

### Steps to reproduce

![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/18515648/135049113-7b307e29-53f3-4f60-89e1-5bc59cfa29ee.png)
The above change was not backwards compatible, and seemed to have broken the following code of mine:
```
reset(
  {
    filters: filters,
  },
  { keepValues: true }
);
```

# Steps
1. Make change to form element (i.e. type something in text `<input>`, for example).
2. `isDirty` is set to `true`, triggering a `useEffect`.
3. Invoke the above `reset` snippet within the aforementioned `useEffect`.
4. The form element that was modified should still be focused (blinking cursor should not disappear).
4. Make another change to the same form element. Any further changes **do not** set `isDirty` to `true`, which is not the correct behavior.

### Expected behaviour

I expect `isDirty` to be set to `true` on any change to the form element, regardless of whether or not the form is `reset` with `{ keepValues: true }`.

I cannot remove `{ keepValues: true }`, because then the form element loses focus when `reset` is called.

I had to downgrade to version `7.15.2` for it to work as expected, so version `7.15.3` was where the breaking change was made.

In the image that I posted above, you can see that `_formValues` is not set if `keepStateOptions.keepValues` is set to `true`, which is different than the behavior in version `7.15.2`.

### What browsers are you seeing the problem on?

Chrome

### Relevant log output

_No response_

### Code of Conduct

- [X] I agree to follow this project's Code of Conduct
